title: ContextASR-Bench: A Massive Contextual Speech Recognition Benchmark
author: He Wang (Alibaba Group), Linhan Ma (Alibaba Group), Dake Guo (Alibaba Group), Xiong Wang (Alibaba Group), Lei Xie (Alibaba Group), Jin Xu (Alibaba Group), Junyang Lin (Alibaba Group)
relevance_why: The benchmark focuses on contextual speech recognition, which includes capturing complex domain-specific terminology and named entities that can enhance Haohe Liu's research in audio and speech generation tasks.
background: The benchmark evaluates speech recognition systems in recognizing spoken content with and without context, emphasizing world knowledge and contextual understanding.
contribution: ContextASR-Bench introduces a new evaluative framework for Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) that integrates contextual factors, achieving better assessment of model performance across diverse domains.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous ASR benchmarks often focus on context-less paradigms which underutilize the capabilities of advanced models like Large Audio Language Models (LALMs).
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances evaluation by including context-rich scenarios and emphasizes recognition of named entities and technical terms, providing a more practical testing ground.

key_innovation: The benchmark allows for contextual evaluation settings and incorporates a large variety of data from multiple domains, facilitating comprehensive assessment of ASR systems.
real_world_impact: By improving the evaluation of ASR systems, ContextASR-Bench can influence future developments in speech technology, making it more effective in practical applications such as virtual assistants and automated transcription.
limitations: The authors acknowledge limitations such as using fully synthesized speech, which might lack diversity compared to real-world recordings.

new_terms.Large Audio Language Models (LALMs): **Large Audio Language Models (LALMs)** are advanced models that combine audio processing capabilities with natural language understanding, enabling more robust contextual interpretation in speech tasks.

open_sourcing: The dataset and evaluation code have been released at https://github.com/MrSupW/ContextASR-Bench.
